  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    approveCapsule()
    This function prompts the user to input information about a capsule to approve and then calls a method to approve the capsule in a project.
    void
    executeChoice(int choice)
    This function executes different actions based on the user's choice.
    void
    finishStage()
    This function prompts the user to input the name of a project and the current date, then uses a project controller to finish the current stage of the project and outputs a confirmation message.
    static void
    main(String[] args)
    The main function runs a loop that displays a menu, validates user input, and executes the selected choice until the user chooses to exit.
    void
    menu()
    The function displays a menu with options for creating a project, finishing a project stage, registering a capsule, approving a capsule, publishing a capsule, or exiting the program.
    void
    publishCapsule()
    This function prompts the user to input a project name and capsule ID, then calls a project controller to publish the capsule and returns a URL.
    void
    registCapsule()
    This function registers a capsule by taking input from the user and passing it to a project controller.
    void
    registProject()
    This function registers a new project by taking input from the user for project name, client name, expected start and end dates, and budget, and then adds the project to the project controller.
    void
    registStages()
    This function registers stages for a project by taking input from the user for project name, expected start date, and real start date.
    void
    searchLectionsByKeyword()
    This function prompts the user to input a hashtag and then calls a method to search for lectures that contain that hashtag.
    void
    searchProjectWithMoreCapsules()
    This function searches for a project with the highest number of capsules and prints the result.
    void
    setEndDates()
    This function sets the end dates for a project based on user input for the project name and the number of months required to complete the next stage.
    void
    setStartDates()
    This function sets the start dates for a project based on user input of the project name.
    void
    showCapsulesByType()
    This function prints out information about capsules grouped by their type.
    void
    showCapsulesLection()
    This function prompts the user to input a project name and stage, then calls a method to retrieve and display the lections associated with that project and stage.
    Calendar
    stringsToCalendar(String date)
    The function converts a string date in the format "dd/MM/yyyy" to a Calendar object.
    void
    validateIfWokerHasRegisteredCapsules()
    This function ask the user to input a worker's name and then calls a method to search for capsules associated with that worker.
    int
    validateIntegerInput()
    This function validates user input to ensure it is an integer value.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception
      The main function runs a loop that displays a menu, validates user input, and executes the selected choice until the user chooses to exit.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • menu

      public void menu()
      The function displays a menu with options for creating a project, finishing a project stage, registering a capsule, approving a capsule, publishing a capsule, or exiting the program.

    • executeChoice

      public void executeChoice(int choice) throws Exception
      This function executes different actions based on the user's choice.
      Parameters:
      choice - an integer representing the user's choice from a menu of options. The method executes different actions based on the value of this parameter.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • validateIntegerInput

      public int validateIntegerInput()
      This function validates user input to ensure it is an integer value.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an integer value, which is either the user input if it is a valid integer, or -1 if the user input is not a valid integer.

    • registCapsule

      public void registCapsule()
      This function registers a capsule by taking input from the user and passing it to a project controller.

    • registProject

      public void registProject() throws Exception
      This function registers a new project by taking input from the user for project name, client name, expected start and end dates, and budget, and then adds the project to the project controller.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • registStages

      public void registStages() throws Exception
      This function registers stages for a project by taking input from the user for project name, expected start date, and real start date.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • finishStage

      public void finishStage() throws Exception
      This function prompts the user to input the name of a project and the current date, then uses a project controller to finish the current stage of the project and outputs a confirmation message.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • setStartDates

      public void setStartDates()
      This function sets the start dates for a project based on user input of the project name.

    • setEndDates

      public void setEndDates()
      This function sets the end dates for a project based on user input for the project name and the number of months required to complete the next stage.

    • approveCapsule

      public void approveCapsule() throws Exception
      This function prompts the user to input information about a capsule to approve and then calls a method to approve the capsule in a project.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • publishCapsule

      public void publishCapsule()
      This function prompts the user to input a project name and capsule ID, then calls a project controller to publish the capsule and returns a URL.

    • showCapsulesByType

      public void showCapsulesByType()
      This function prints out information about capsules grouped by their type.

    • showCapsulesLection

      public void showCapsulesLection()
      This function prompts the user to input a project name and stage, then calls a method to retrieve and display the lections associated with that project and stage.

    • searchProjectWithMoreCapsules

      public void searchProjectWithMoreCapsules()
      This function searches for a project with the highest number of capsules and prints the result.

    • validateIfWokerHasRegisteredCapsules

      public void validateIfWokerHasRegisteredCapsules()
      This function ask the user to input a worker's name and then calls a method to search for capsules associated with that worker.

    • searchLectionsByKeyword

      public void searchLectionsByKeyword()
      This function prompts the user to input a hashtag and then calls a method to search for lectures that contain that hashtag.

    • stringsToCalendar

      public Calendar stringsToCalendar(String date) throws Exception
      The function converts a string date in the format "dd/MM/yyyy" to a Calendar object.
      Parameters:
      date - The date parameter is a string representing a date in the format "dd/MM/yyyy".
      Returns:
      A Calendar object is being returned.
      Throws:
      Exception
